page.title: 15FARMING IN LAMERTON.
page.content: young bullocks for meat.He has got 102 acres,80 acres of grass-land and the rest of it is corn. He has a cow shed which is quite big .He does not keep a dog.His farm has changed over the years because the churns have changed to bulk tanks. There are also more cattle where there used to be sheep.The milk they sell per litre costs 15p.{Mr Hill}has 40 calves in the average year.{Mr Hill}only sells some of the calves.He keeps the rest of them.He doesn't employ any-body.Mr Hill grows his own hay and makes his own silage for the cows to eat.He gets up at 7.00 and in the summer he comes in at 11.00 p.m.Grass grows best because we have a lot of rain.He is a member of the National Farmer's Union, because they help farmers with advice, and represent them in E.E.C.business. ABIGAIL FRASER ALEX FISHER
